alert.note: Alert for Etowah (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 07 at 10:00PM CDT until June 08 at 4:15AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Etowah. * WHEN...Until 600 AM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 PM CDT, Emergency Management reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gadsden, Rainbow City, Attalla, Hokes Bluff, Glencoe, Gadsden Mall, Noccalula Falls, Neely Henry Lake, Southside, Big Wills Creek, Gadsden Steam Plant, Gadsden Water Works, Northside, Cobb City and Gadsden Municipal Airport.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
